projectDesc.p: Hugoye: Journal of Syriac Studies is an electronic journal dedicated to the study of the Syriac tradition, published semi-annually (in January and July) by Beth Mardutho: The Syriac Institute. Published since 1998, Hugoye seeks to offer the best scholarship available in the field of Syriac studies.

body.head: Call for Registration
body.p: [1] St. Mark's Cathedral, on the occasion of its 50th Anniversary, is holding an international symposium on Jacob of Sarug and His Times. The symposium will be held on October 24-26, 2008 at 260 Elm Ave, Teaneck, NJ. The symposium speakers are:

list.item: Sharbil Alexandre Bcheiry, Syriac Orthodox Archdiocese
Sebastian P. Brock, University of Oxford
Sidney Griffith, The Catholic University of America
George A. Kiraz, Beth Mardutho & Gorgias Press
Edward G. Mathews, St. Nerses Seminary

body.p: [2] To register contact Info@SyrianOrthodoxChurch.Org or (201) 907-0122. The Symposium Secretary is Jack C. Darakjy, Symposium Secretariat, 161 Main Street, Suite 2, Hackensack, NJ 07601-7114.

[3] Accommodation: Attendees are expected to make their own arrangements. The closest hotel (2 miles from the Cathedral) is the Teaneck Marriott at Glenpointe, 100 Frank W Burr Blvd, Teaneck, NJ 07666, Tel. 800-804-6835. Web site: Teaneck Marriott.
[4] Travel: The closest airport is Newark International, ca. 20 minutes drive from Teaneck. The closest train station is NJ Transit station at Hackensack.
